result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan M Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:24 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 14, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Sentencing After Revocation - 2015CF53 & 2015CM41

Atty Privat has received a copy of the revocation packet with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CF53

Count 2 - 9 months county jail, with huber and concurrent to 2015CM41.  Court orders the court costs of $443.00 be reduced to a civil judgement. 

Count 4 - 90 days county jail with huber and consecutive to any other sentence.  Court orders the court costs of $443.00 be reduced to a civil judgment.

2015CM41

Count 1 - 9 months county jail - with huber and to commence immediately.  

Court orders court costs of $443.00 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Court grants the defendant 53 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 1:33 p.m.
from Baraboo Office of State Public Defender - defendant qualifies for PD representation and will be appointing counsel from the FDL Office.
Marquette County Jail - 11/10/2015 at 1:00 p.m. (Sentencing after revocation)
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 11-10-2015 01:00 pm

Prior: 340 S State St, Neshkoro, WI 54960
Judgment of Conviction has been returned.  Return to sender.  Moved, Left no address.  Unable to Forward.  Return to sender.

1:02 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, will not be getting an attorney.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court questions defendant regarding preliminary hearing.  Statement by defendant, will waive the preliminary hearing.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  DA recites agreement, defendant will plea to Resisting on 2015CM41 and counts 2 & 4 on 2015CF53.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 (with no repeater) on 2015CM41 and counts 2 & 4 (with no repeater) on 2015CF53.  Court orders count 2 on 2015CM41 and counts 1 & 3 on 2015CF53 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CM41 (count 1)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year concurrent to each other.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs
AODA
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

2015CF53 (counts 2 & 4)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year, concurrent to each other.

CONDITIONS:

court costs
AODA
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court adjourned at 1: p.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

3:27 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant does not qualify for PD representation.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 11, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:31 p.m.
